item.title: A R C A D E - MisterMaster [Drum'n'Bass]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Awesome, I like the drum sample you cut up. Synth work on point, drum programming on point

The end was a little abrupt. I don’t think you need to make it longer necessarily, but, it is SCREAMING for some kind of very old school arcade bit crushed sample and then WHAM silence. Like when pacman dies, or etc. Something haha. But that’s the only suggestion I’ve got otherwise!!

Read full topic

item.description:
Yeah. I guess the reason DNB producers do this is because the hits already sounded good together in the original loop, so after changing the order of hits, they may still sound good together.

item.title: A R C A D E - MisterMaster [Drum'n'Bass]
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Thanks! The new Auxy features open the door for more Drum and Bass.

Although the Auxy subscription has heaps of drums, I used Audacity on my Mac to load a .wav drum loop from the web and then split it into individual drum hits samples, which I loaded individually into Auxy via iCloud, then programmed a new drum loop from the hits.

Read full topic
